page.title: 01CHANGES IN SCAMPTON VILLAGE
page.content: Scampton village is bordered on the West, by a lime stone ridge which runs all the way to Lincoln and on the East by the River Till. It is bordered on the South by Till Bridge Lane which is an old Roman road. The Northern boundary is the next village which is called Aisthorpe. The old Jurassic road used to run all along the lime stone ridge but R.A.F. Scampton spread and covered part of the road. There was never a pottery in Scampton nor a village green. Most people kept pigs but only about five people kept cows. When Christmas time came most people killed their pigs. There were very few houses in Scampton 50 years ago it was mostly grass and fields which ran all the way to Lincoln.
